Module simplifier
Package ie.gmit.dip

Class InteractiveTextSimplifierSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.InteractiveTextSimplifierSession
  • public class InteractiveTextSimplifierSession
extends java.lang.Object
    InteractiveTextSimplifierSession is a simple utility class that allows the user to interact with and control the functionality embedded in the ThesaurusMapTextSimplifier via an in-built menu (RunnableCommandLineOptionMenu) of RunnableCommandLineOption options. Each RunnableCommandLineOption option is defined as a Runnable defined via a lambda expression which calls on a pre-existing method in the ThesaurusMapTextSimplifier class. These Runnable types are used to compose a RunnableCommandLineOptionMenu which the user interacts with directly from the terminal.
    Since:
    JavaSE-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kieran P. Somers
    See Also:
    ThesaurusMapTextSimplifier, RunnableCommandLineOption, RunnableCommandLineOptionMenu

    • Constructor Detail

      • InteractiveTextSimplifierSession

        public InteractiveTextSimplifierSession()
        A simple constructor to instantiate the session.

    • Method Detail

      • printTitle

        public void printTitle()
        A simple method to print a title to the terminal. Has O(c) running time.

      • start

        public void start()
        A method to start the session. Prints the title to screen, builds the (RunnableCommandLineOptionMenu) menu of RunnableCommandLineOption options and then keeps the menu open so that the user can interact with the in various ways. Running time is dependent on command line options being called by user.

      • buildMenuOptions

        public void buildMenuOptions()
        A method which builds the list of RunnableCommandLineOption menu options which can be run from the current session. Each option is defined as a Runnable defined via a lambda expression which calls on a pre-existing method in the ThesaurusMapTextSimplifier class. These Runnable types are used to compose a RunnableCommandLineOptionMenu which the user interacts with directly from the terminal. Effectively has O(c) running time.
